p: The ratio of women to men was 1.80 (59 males and 106 females). Of the 167 included patients (age range from 20 to 91 years), 53.9% were aged over 50 years, with a mean (±SD) age of 51.35 (±16.10) years. Native American origins (n = 65, 38.92%) and Sub-Saharan African origins (n = 50, 29.94%) were the most represented. Cardiovascular and rheumatologic diseases were the most common pre-existing comorbidities: 36 (21.56%) participants had high blood pressure, 28 (16.77%) had healed fractures, 14 (8.38%) had osteoarthritis, 13 (7.78%) had diabetes, 13 (7.78%) had dyslipidemia, 11 (6.59%) had rheumatologic inflammatory diseases, and 9 (5.39%) had cancer.
